Question: From the age of about twelve until he was seventeen, this person was educated at The King's School, Grantham.
Hints: He was born three months after the death of his father, a prosperous farmer also named this person.
This person's work has been said "to distinctly advance every branch of mathematics then studied".
This person also claimed that the four types could be obtained by plane projection from one of them, and this was proved in 1731.
